notes.title: React
notes.details: Different columns can be specified by passing an object containing key's of the window widths and their value as the number of columns. To have a fallback value, use the default key.

notes.title: Call my cat
notes.details: We can add the following to the above CSS to further adjust the layout between screen sizes.

notes.title: New one
notes.details: Existing solutions like React wrapped DeSandro Masonry, while popular, don't actually leverage React's highly optimized Virtual DOM renderer and in DeSandro Masonry's case, actually renders elements twice before showing the layout. All of this is ok but we found it to lead to a slow, "laggy" user experience that would occasionally miss-rende
